<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Containers </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>



</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Add weapons to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units. Ignores available cargo space.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3</title><part><name index="1"/><value>In Arma 3, arguments for this command must be local (<template><title>EffArg</title><part><name index="1"/><value>cmd</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>arg</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>loc</value></part></template>). For global variant see [[addWeaponCargoGlobal]].</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> vehicleName [[addWeaponCargo]] [weaponName, count] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicleName: [[Object]] - vehicle to add the weapons to </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [weaponName, count]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> weaponName: [[String]] - weapon name. See [[:Category:Weapons]] for reference about possible values. </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> count: [[Number]] - number of weapons to add. </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_truck [[addWeaponCargo]] ["M16", 5];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[addWeaponCargoGlobal]], [[addMagazineCargo]], [[addMagazineCargoGlobal]], [[clearMagazineCargo]], [[clearWeaponCargo]], [[getWeaponCargo]], [[addItemCargo]], [[addItemCargoGlobal]], [[addBackpackCargo]], [[addBackpackCargoGlobal]], [[addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargo]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on October 24, 2009 - 11:02 (CEST)
<dt class="note">[[User:Sbsmac|Sbsmac]]
<dd class="note">Only works on clients.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 10, 2010 - 11:02
<dt class="note">[[User:Galzohar|Galzohar]]
<dd class="note">When players add/remove gear directly via the gear menu that gear is synchronized across the network. Since this command is local only, using it during a mission can cause all sorts of weird issues. To get proper synchronization use this command in the object's init line or in a script called from its init line with a '''call compile preprocessFile''' command (and ''not'' '''execVM''').

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
